description:
Application under Section 73 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 for variations to Conditions 3 (Reserved Matters), 5 (Architectural Design Code), 6 (Placemaking Code), 7 (Parameter Plans), 8 (Land Uses), 10 (Distribution of Land Uses), 11 (Development Zone Land Uses), 13 (Maximum Residential units), 14 (Residential Mix), 18 (Phasing Plan), 20 (Car Parking), 21 (Residential Car Parking Spaces) and 61 (Approved Drawings) to outline planning permission dated 25th September 2020 (ref. 2020/0579) for:
"the restoration, extension, alterations and conversion of the Power Station building to provide retail, residential flats, business, cultural, hotel and conference facilities, event space and incidental accommodation; the demolition of other buildings and development of the land surrounding the Power Station and adjacent/nearby sites to provide retail, restaurants bars and cafes, offices, hotel, residential, community and cultural space, assembly and leisure space, serviced apartments, an energy centre and basement plant; parking for cars, coaches, motorcycles and bicycles; new access and internal road system and servicing; 'off-site' highway works; works to the jetty and riverwall to facilitate river transport and fuel delivery; provision of open space and landscaping."
The planning application is accompanied by an Environmental Statement Addendum.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - 1. The hereby approved development commenced on 28th October 2013.

Reason: To comply with Section 92 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.
Condition : 2 - 2. Phase 1 of the development shall be carried out in accordance with the reserved matters approved on the 20th December 2012 (ref: 2012/4584), the 8th May 2013 (ref: 2013/1192), the 20th December 2013 (ref: 2013/4229), the 2nd November 2015 (ref: 2015/2320), the 8th November 2016 (ref: 2016/5098), the 18th May 2017 (ref: 2017/1248) and the 8th January 2020 (ref: 2019/4769) pursuant to condition 3 of the outline planning permission dated 23rd August 2011 (ref: 2009/3575); or in accordance with reserved matters approved pursuant to condition 3 of this permission. 

Reason: To ensure these Phases are implemented in accordance with the approved detailed permissions and reserved matters.
Condition : 3 - 3. Approval of details of the following reserved matters shall be obtained from the Local Planning Authority in respect of each Phase of development other than Phases 2, 3A, 3B,3D and 3PP) as set out on the Phasing Plan (dated July 2021), and any subsequent updated Phasing Plan as approved:

a)	The scale of the buildings and structures within that phase
b)	The external appearance of those buildings and structures, including facing materials
c)	Landscaping of that phase, and
d)	The layout of buildings and distribution of land uses within that phase.

Details (in the form of a Statement of Compliance) of how each phase complies with the approved site-wide development controls (i.e. Parameter Plans, Design Code, Regulatory Document and Development Specification) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in association with each reserved matter submission made pursuant to this condition. The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the details as approved. 

The reserved matters approved on the 20th December 2012 (ref: 2012/4584), the 8th May 2013 (ref: 2013/1192), the 20th December 2013 (ref: 2013/4229), the 2nd November 2015 (ref: 2015/2320 and 2015/2331), the 8th November 2016 (ref: 2016/5098), the 18th May 2017 (ref: 2017/1248) and the 8th January 2020 (ref: 2019/4769) have discharged the foregoing requirements in relation to Phase 1.

Reason: To comply with Section 92 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. Planning policy will evolve throughout the development and the reserved matters applications should take account of this.
Condition : 4 - 4. None of the works which are the subject of the details required in condition 03 shall be commenced without the prior written approval of those details by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: In order that the Local Planning Authority may be satisfied as to the details of the development.
Condition : 5 - 5. The details of scale, layout and appearance submitted in relation to condition 03 shall be in accordance with the elements in the Design Code (September 2021), identified as mandatory within that Code, and any subsequent reviews and updates to that Code as approved by the Local Planning Authority as a submission made pursuant to this condition.

Reason: To control the appearance and architectural form of the development, and to ensure a high quality and co-ordinated design for the built form, in accordance with policy IS3 of the Core Strategy (Adopted March 2016), and policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (Adopted March 2016) (DMPD).
Condition : 6 - 6. The details of landscaping submitted in relation to condition 03 shall be in accordance with the elements in the Design Code (September 2021), identified as mandatory within that Code and shall demonstrate how accessibility for people with disabilities is incorporated within all areas of public realm, and any subsequent reviews or updates to that Code as approved by the Local Planning Authority as a submission made pursuant to this condition.

Reason: To control the appearance of the development and to ensure a high quality and co-ordinated design for the landscaping, and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme. In order to ensure that people with disabilities can satisfactorily use and access the finished development, in accordance with DMPD policy DMS1.
Condition : 7 - 7. The details submitted in relation to condition 03 shall be in accordance with the scale and massing and layout limitations set by the submitted parameter plans or as otherwise specified in this schedule.

Reason: The merits and environmental impacts of the proposed development have been assessed in relation to the form of the development shown on the submitted parameter plans. In order to ensure the development proceeds on the basis of the scheme on which an Environmental Impact Assessment has been undertaken, the permission needs to be substantially tied to the details assessed, and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme, in accordance with DMPD policy DMS1.
Condition : 8 - 8. The total gross external floorspace areas of the uses hereby approved in accordance with this planning permission shall be limited to the following (and the stipulated sub category of the use class within the table below):

Overall gross external floorspace area of all the uses (excluding parking, servicing, general plant and storage and the energy centre) shall not exceed 807,774sqm

Retail and Professional and financial services	E(a)/E(c)	64,508
Retail	E(a)/E(c)/Pub or drinking establishment	206

Retail / Leisure	E(a)/E(c)/E(d)	75
Food and beverage / Community and culture / Leisure	E(a)/E(b)/E(c)/E(d)/E(e)/E(f)/Pub or drinking establishment/Takeaway/F1/F2	1,419

Leisure	E(d)/F2/Cinema, concert hall, bingo hall and dance hall	6,510
Community and culture / Leisure / Medical / Education	E(e)/E(f)/F1/F2/ Cinema, concert hall, bingo hall and dance hall	68,357

The total gross external floorspace areas of the uses hereby approved in accordance with this planning permission shall also be limited in the following ways:

The overall gross external area of Retail and Professional and financial services, Food and beverage, Community and culture / Leisure / Medical / Education uses floorspace (excluding the floorspace within Phases 1, 2, 3A, 3B, 3D, 3PP and the buildings and structures on the jetty) shall comprise at least 15,000sqm (GEA) at any one time, of which
"	a minimum of 3,0
Condition : 9 - 9. No extensions of floorspace in addition to that shown on the submitted drawings specified in this schedule shall be provided in, on or below the Power Station Building without the express approval of the Local Planning Authority pursuant to this condition or by a further planning permission in that regard.

Reason: To restrict the extent of uses in, on or below the Power Station building to those proposed and assessed, and to ensure a suitable mix of uses within the development.
Condition : 10 - 10. Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Permitted Development Order 2021 or any Order replacing or re-enacting its provisions, the distribution of Classes of Use within Phases 2, 3A, 3B, 3D and 3PP, as set out on the Phasing Plan (dated July 2021), and any subsequent updated Phasing Plan as approved, shall not be otherwise than as shown on the submitted drawings specified in this schedule.

Reason: In assessing the scheme, the Local Planning Authority has had regard to the appropriateness of the manner in which the various uses have been arranged and distributed within Phases 2, 3A, 3B, 3D and 3PP, and would wish to control any adjustments to the submitted arrangements.
Condition : 11 - 11. Subject to further restriction by other conditions attached to this planning permission, the maximum floorspace area to be provided in the outline element for each Phase or Development Zone shall not exceed that set out in the following table: - 

	RS-4 (Phase 3C)	RS-2 (Phase 6)	RS-5 (Phase 4)	RS-6 (Phase 5)	RSWF (Phase 7)
Areas in sqm (GEA)	54,631	116,242	141,017	29,705	35,092

Reason: To restrict the levels of the floorspace of the various uses within the development to the Development Zone proposed to ensure a suitable mix, balance and distribution of the uses throughout the development.
Condition : 12 - 12. The distribution of uses within each Phase shall be in accordance with the parameter plans hereby approved unless otherwise submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority pursuant to this condition or a further planning permission is granted in that behalf. The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the details as approved.

The details approved on the 2nd November 2015 (ref: 2015/2321) and 4th November 2016 (ref. 2016/4808) have partially satisfied the foregoing requirements in relation to Phase 1.

Reason: The impacts and the suitability of the various uses within the proposed development have been assessed in relation to their distribution across the site, as shown on the submitted parameter plans. In order to ensure the development proceeds on the basis of the scheme on which the assessment has been undertaken, the permission needs to be substantially tied to the details assessed, and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme.
Condition : 13 - 13. The residential (Class C3) accommodation hereby approved (excluding that within Phases 2, 3A, 3B and 3D) shall not exceed 2,767 units overall.

The number of residential units in Development Zone RS-1 (Phase 1) shall not exceed 865 units.

The total minimum number of residential units across the site shall be 2,500 and the total maximum number of residential units across the site shall not exceed 3,853 units, at any one time.

Reason: To control the number of residential units, to accord with the planning application and to accord substantially with the number and mix of units set out in the Environmental Statement (November 2015) and its addenda dated February 2016, February 2020 and July 2021, in accordance with Core Strategy policy IS5 and DMPD policy DMH9.
Condition : 14 - 14. The residential accommodation within each Phase (excluding that within Phases 1, 2, 3A, 3B and 3D as shown on the Phasing Plan (July 2021) and any subsequent updated Phasing Plan) shall include units of a mix of sizes substantially in accordance with the following mix:

"	Studio units:                   11%
"	1 bedroom units:            24%
"	2 bedroom units:            42%
"	3 bedroom units:            16%
"	4 bedroom units:            2% 
"	Penthouse units:            5%

The Statement of Compliance submitted in accordance with Condition 03 for each Phase containing residential accommodation shall identify the proposed mix and the extent to which it is not substantially in accordance with this mix, providing justification for any departure in relation to the site-specific considerations set out in the Development Specification. 

Reason: To replicate the unit mix of the residential accommodation to that assessed and, in general accordance with Core Strategy policy IS5 and DMPD policy DMH3.
Condition : 15 - 15 Details of the distribution and internal configuration of residential units shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing in association with the details required under condition 03. The details shall show how policy and supplementary guidance in effect at the time of the reserved matters approvals will be met. All units shall be in accordance with the Mayor's Housing Standards, the DCLG's Technical Housing Standards, and 90% of the units shall meet Building Regulation requirement M4(2) 'accessible and adaptable dwellings' and 10% of the units shall meet Building Regulation requirement M4(3) 'wheelchair user dwellings'. The development shall not be implemented otherwise than in accordance with those details as may be approved unless subsequent alternative details are submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority pursuant to this condition.

The details approved on the 20th December 2012 (ref: 2012/4586), 8th May 2013 (ref: 2013/1193), 20th December 2013 (ref: 2013/4229) the 2nd November 2015 (ref: 2015/2321) and the 4th November 2016 (ref. 2016/4808) have partially satisfied the foregoing requirements in relation to Phase 1. 

Reason: To ensure satisfactory residential accommodation is provided, including for people with disabilities, in accordance with Core Strategy policy IS5, and DMPD policy DMH4.
Condition : 16 - 16. Condition deleted by this application.
Condition : 17 - 17. Condition deleted under application 2014/2837.
Condition : 18 - 18. The phasing of the development shall be in accordance with that set out in the Phasing Plan (dated July 2021), and any subsequent updated Phasing Plan as approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing made pursuant to this condition 18 or in association with the details required under condition 03, together with an Environmental Statement complying with the requirements of the Environmental Impact Assessment Regulations 2017 as amended (and any successor thereto) and in the event that the Local Planning Authority considers that there is likely to be a significantly different environmental impact arising from the implementation of the updated Phasing Plan, and that updated Phasing Plan is approved by the Local Planning Authority pursuant to this condition (having regard to any Environmental Statement as has been supplied), the phasing of the development shall be in accordance with that set out in the updated Phasing Plan as approved. 

Reason: To control the phasing of the development, to accord with the planning application, and to accord substantially with the assessments set out in the Environmental Statement dated July 2009 and its addendums dated June 2010, September 2010, May 2013, June 2013, February 2020 and July 2021. 
Condition : 19 - 19. The landscape works and planting as may be approved for each Phase of the development shall be carried out in accordance with a programme agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority, pursuant to this condition, prior to occupation of 70% of the relevant phase of the development. Details of the hard and soft landscaping for that part of the development approved in detail, shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing prior to the commencement of landscaping works in the relevant phase.

a) The details shall include all street furniture, boundary treatment, fencing between private and public areas, lighting, cycle stands, seating, bins and play equipment, including their scale, design, materials and location.
b) The location of trees and other planting which projects above the balustrade on the roof garden in Development Zone O1 shall be in general accordance with drawings A-1244 and A-1245 (both Rev 02).
c) The details shall include the wind mitigation measures identified in the Environmental Statement and Environmental Statement Addendum (February 2020).
The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details as approved. 

The details approved on the 06th June 2016 (ref: 2016/2790) and 14th October 2016 (ref. 2016/5229) have partially satisfied the foregoing requirements in relation to Phase 1. The details approved on 24th January 2019 (ref. 2018/5420) and 28th April 2020 (ref. 2020/0811) have partially satisfied the foregoing requirements in relation to Phase 3A. The details approved on 19th May 2021 (ref. 2020/4826) have partially satisfied the foregoing requirements in relation to Malaysia Square and the Southeast Roundabout in Phase 3A. The details approved on 1st June 2021 (ref. 2021/1350) have partially satisfied the foregoing requirements in relation to Phase 3PP (Prospect Park South).

Reason: In order that the landscaping is provided in co-ordination with the phasing of develo
Condition : 20 - 20. A) The car parking provided on the site shall not exceed a maximum of 3,094 spaces. No more than 1,448 of those spaces shall be available for use by the public, and no more than 68 of the spaces shall be allocated to or provided in connection with the Class E(g) business use. 

B) Details of the proposed land use for the flexible Class E(a)/E(b)/E(c)/Pub and drinking establishment/Takeaway floorspace within the Power Station Building are to be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing prior to the commencement of that use, and the maximum car parking provision for this floorspace is to be calculated in accordance with the approved car parking ratios contained within the Transport Assessment (May 2014) and Transport Assessment Addendum (July 2014, February 2021 and July 2021). The maximum caps for the total number of car parking spaces on the site and for use by the public shall be set taking account of this provision subject to the absolute maximums stated in this condition. The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the details as approved.

Reason: To avoid creating unacceptable traffic congestion on the surrounding road network and adversely affecting the amenity of local residents and businesses, in accordance with Core Strategy policy IS1, and DMPD policies DMT1 and DMT2.
Condition : 21 - 21. The maximum level of parking to be provided for the Class C3 residential use shall not exceed the following ratios for each Development Zone:

Zone RS-1:       0.5 spaces per unit 
Zone RS-2:       0.41 spaces per unit 
Zone RS-4:       0.41 spaces per unit 
Zone RS-5:       0.41 spaces per unit 
Zone RS-6a:     0.41 spaces per unit 
Zone RS-6b:     0.1 spaces per unit 
Zone RSWF:     0.41 spaces per unit 
Zone O-1:         0.41 spaces per unit 
Power Station:  capped at 130 spaces.

Reason: To limit the number of parking spaces within each Development Zone having regard to the characteristics of accommodation within each zone and the phasing of the development, in accordance with Core Strategy policy IS1, and DMPD policy DMT2.
Condition : 22 - 22. The Site Wide Parking Management Strategy shall be implemented in accordance with the details approved on the 31st July 2015 (ref: 2015/2916); or in accordance with an updated site wide strategy as may be approved in writing by the local planning authority pursuant to this condition. The Site Wide Parking Management Strategy shall include pricing structure (to include pricing to deter commuter parking); means of separating public, operational and residential parking and enforcing that separation; allocation of residential spaces between market and affordable units; approach to allocation of parking for people with mobility problems and wheelchair users; car club allocation; cycle parking/storage differentiated by residential, public and other users; charging points for electric vehicles; means of control on parking at ground level and a scheme for enforcement; access controls to the underground parking; and, handling the relationship between private and service vehicles. The Site Wide Parking Management Strategy shall be reviewed prior to commencement of each Phase of development and a Car Parking Management Plan providing the detail of how the Car Park Management Strategy will be applied to each Development Zone or Phase, as appropriate, shall be submitted prior to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of excavation works associated with that Zone or Phase. The details submitted in accordance with Condition 3 shall be in accordance with the Site Wide Parking Management Strategy and appropriate Car Parking Management Plan. The development shall not be operated otherwise than in accordance with the Site Wide Parking Management Strategy and Car Park Management Plans as may be approved unless subsequent alternative details are submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority pursuant to this condition.

The details approved on the 17th October 2013 (ref: 2013/3327) and 25th October 2018 (ref. 2018/4213) 
Condition : 23 - 23. A minimum of 10% of all the parking spaces hereby approved shall be suitable for the use of wheelchair users and shall be provided in accordance with the details as may be approved under condition 22. The spaces shall be permanently retained for persons with mobility disabilities.

Reason: To ensure that adequate parking facilities for people with disabilities are provided and retained on site, in accordance with Core Strategy policy IS1, and DMPD policy DMT2.
Condition : 24 - 24. The parking areas as may be approved in relation to the Power Station Building and the Development Zones shall be provided before the first occupation of the floorspace to which it is associated in the relevant Development Zone or the Power Station Building, or in accordance with a timetable that shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority 3 months prior to first occupation of any part of associated floorspace within the relevant Development Zone or the Power Station Building. The car parking serving the non-residential accommodation within the Development Zone RS-1 is to be provided in accordance with the note 'Delivery of Basement Car Parking Provision - Phase 1 Circus West' dated April 2016.

Reason: To ensure adequate provision is made for off-street parking and to avoid creating unacceptable traffic congestion on the surrounding road network and adversely affecting the amenity of local residents and businesses, in accordance with Core Strategy policy IS1, and DMPD policies DMT1 and DMT2.
Condition : 25 - 25. Details of coach, bus, taxi and ground level cycle parking, and service area provision shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing in association with the details required under condition 03. The provision as may be approved shall be provided and permanently retained for the prescribed uses unless subsequent alternative details are submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority pursuant to this condition.

The details approved on the 20th December 2012 (ref: 2012/4586), 8th May 2013 (ref: 2013/1193) and the 2nd November 2015 (ref: 2015/2321) have partially satisfied the foregoing requirements in relation to Phase 1; and the details approved on 10th March 2015 (ref: 2014/7029) have partially satisfied the foregoing requirements in relation to Phase 2. 

Reason: To ensure appropriate facilities are provided and retained on site, in accordance policy Core Strategy policy IS1, and DMPD policy DMT2.
Condition : 26 - 26. Details, including plans, of the individual size, configuration, access and servicing arrangements, and separation of one from another, of the commercial, community, leisure and institutional units shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing in association with the details required under condition 03. The development shall not be implemented otherwise than in accordance with those details as may be approved unless subsequent alternative details are submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority pursuant to this condition.

The details approved on the 20th December 2012 (ref: 2012/4586), 8th May 2013 (ref: 2013/1193), the 2nd November 2015 (ref: 2015/2321) and 4th November 2016 (ref. 2016/4808) have partially satisfied the foregoing requirements in relation to Phase 1; and the details approved on the 10th March 2015 (ref: 2014/7029) have partially satisfied the foregoing requirements in relation to Phase 2. 

Reason: To ensure satisfactory dispersion of units, and that adequate access and servicing arrangements are provided and retained on site, in accordance with Core Strategy policy IS1, and DMPD policy DMT2.
Condition : 27 - 27. Details of the amount, spatial distribution and differentiation between Class E(a) and Class E(c) uses within the areas shown to accommodate Retail/Financial and professional services (Class E(a)/E(c) uses) in the parameter plans hereby approved shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing prior to commencement of such uses in Development Zone RS-1 (Phase 1), RS-4 (South) (Phase 3C), RS-2 (Phase 6), RS-5 (Phase 4), RS-6 (Phase 5) and RS-WF (Phase 7), as set out on the Phasing Plan (dated July 2021), and any subsequent updated Phasing Plan as approved. The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the details as approved. The areas so allocated shall not be used for any other purpose than the Class E(a) or E(c) uses as differentiated without the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority pursuant to this condition, notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Permitted Development Order 2021 or any Order replacing or re-enacting its provisions.

The details approved on the 2nd September 2016 (ref. 2016/4829) and 4th November 2016 (ref. 2016/6273) have partially satisfied the foregoing requirements in relation to Phase 1. 

Reason: To control the ratio and distribution of Class E(a) and E(c) uses, and to ensure a suitable mix of uses within the development, in line with Core Strategy policies PL8 and PL11, and DMPD policies DMTS1 and DMTS2.
Condition : 28 - 28. Unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority on an application made pursuant to this condition, no individual Class E(a) unit shall exceed 2,500 sqm GLA (gross lettable area) with the exception of a single unit in the Power Station Building that shall not exceed 5,000sq.m. (GLA). Details of the mix of unit sizes of the E(a)/E(c) class uses shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing prior to the commencement of such use, and no units shall be amalgamated if the resulting area exceeds 1,000 sq.m (GLA) unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority on an application made pursuant to this condition,  The development shall not be implemented otherwise than in accordance with those details as may be approved, unless subsequent alternative details are submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing pursuant to this condition. 

Reason: In permitting the quantum of retail floorspace in the development the Council has had regard to the potential impact on other centres and would wish to reassess that impact of including more large units in the scheme, and to ensure an appropriate mix to the size of units and to prevent the amalgamation of units, in accordance with Core Strategy Policy PL8, and DMPD policies DMTS1 and DMTS2. In addition, smaller units are more affordable and therefore present opportunities for new businesses to emerge.
Condition : 29 - 29. Notwithstanding the provision of the Town and Country Planning Permitted Development Order 2021 or any replacement Order, none of the Class E(b), Pub or drinking establishment and Takeaway floorspace hereby approved shall be used for Class E(a) and/or E(c) purposes (excepting ancillary purposes).

Reason: To prevent an increase in Class E(a) and E(c) uses within the development in the absence of consideration of the impact of such an increase on other centres, and to maintain a suitable mix of uses within the development, in accordance with Core Strategy policies PL8 and PL11, and DMPD policies DMTS1 and DMTS2.
Condition : 30 - 30. Details of any external ventilation equipment, including ducting, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before installation.

Details of ventilation equipment within Phase 1 have been approved on 25th January 2018 (ref. 2017/6490). Details of ventilation equipment at roof level only within Phase 2 have been approved on 10th October 2019 (ref. 2019/3472) and 27th February 2020 (ref. 2020/0242).

Reason: In the interests of local amenity and visual appearance, and in accordance with Core Strategy policy IS3, and DMPD policy DMS1.
Condition : 31 - 31. The Class E(b), Pub or drinking establishment and Takeaway premises shall not be open to customers other than between the hours of 0800 and 2330 and at no other times, unless such hours are first approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority in respect of any individually defined unit pursuant to this condition.

Details of opening hours for the Class E(b)/Pub or drinking establishment/Takeaway units within Phase 1 have been approved on 31st October 2021 (ref. 2016/5295).

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood and local residents, in accordance with DMPD policy DMS1.
Condition : 32 - 32. The uses herby permitted shall not include use in connection with the hiring, distribution of or trading in motor vehicles, or in connection with driving instruction.

Reason: Appropriate parking and service facilities are not provided for such uses in accordance with Core Strategy policy IS1 and DMPD policy DMT2.
Condition : 33 - 33. A) Details, including plans and sections, showing the position (both horizontally and vertically) and physical form of the energy centre shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing, together with details of the proposed capacity of the CHP plant and manner in which the capacity will be accommodated. 

B) Prior to occupation of the C3 residential accommodation in the Power Station Building and of each of the Development Zones, details of how phased introduction of capacity to supply and achieve energy efficiencies and contributions to the CO2 emission reductions are to be achieved for the Power Station Building and the relevant Development Zone. Such details shall be in accordance with the principles set out in the Energy Strategy (December 2013) and subsequent Addendums (December 2014, February 2020 and July 2021) and shall include information on the proposed distribution network and its linkage to the buildings. The development shall not be implemented otherwise than in accordance with the details as may be approved, including the roll-out of phased capacity. The energy centre shall be a minimum of 6,574 sq.m. or such other size as is demonstrated to the Local Planning Authority's satisfaction would meet the capacity requirements and the principles of the Energy Strategy and its addenda through a submission pursuant to this condition. 

The details approved on 10th March 2015 (ref: 2014/7028) have partially satisfied the foregoing requirements in relation to the position and physical form of the Energy Centre. The details approved on 18th October 2016 (ref. 2016/4828) have partially satisfied the foregoing requirements in relation to Phase 1. The details approved on 14th November 2018 (ref. 2018/4489) have partially satisfied the foregoing requirement in relation to Phase 2. The details approved on 13th July 2021 (ref. 2021/2366) have partially satisfied the foregoing requirements in relation to Phases 3A and 3B (Development Z
Condition : 34 - 34. Details of arrangements to facilitate the potential to provide a link from the Energy Centre to the Pimlico heating scheme and the planned VNEB district heat network shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing prior to the construction of the Energy Centre. Such details as may be approved shall be implemented in association with the construction of the Energy Centre. 

The details approved on 10th March 2015 (ref: 2014/7028) have partially satisfied the foregoing requirements in relation to the position and physical form of the Energy Centre for Phase 1. The details approved on 17th May 2017 (ref. 2017/1156) have partially satisfied the foregoing requirements in relation to the position and physical form of the Energy Centre for Phase 2.

Reason: To ensure the implementation of sustainable design, and low carbon development, in accordance with Core Strategy policies SD1 and IS2 and DMPD policy DMS3.
Condition : 35 - 35. A) Prior to the commencement of each Development Zone or Phase, and in association with the reserved matters required by condition 03, a Sustainability and Energy Strategy for the Development Zone or Phase, which shows how it will meet policy and statutory requirements and address Supplementary Planning Documents at the time of reserved matters application, achieving at least a 50% carbon dioxide emissions reduction over Building Regulations 2013 Part L in accordance with the submitted Energy and Sustainability Statement Addendum (July 2021), shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing. The details shall include:

a)	BREEAM assessments targeting 'Outstanding'
b)	Code for Sustainable Homes (or Building Regulations Part L (2013), or such other guidance or legislation as may be applicable at the time of the reserved matters required by condition 03)
c)	passive design measures
d)	energy efficiency measures
e)	renewable technologies
f)	'Be Seen' measures
g)	Carbon offsetting
h)	Whole Life-Carbon assessment (in line with the GLA's Whole Life Carbon Assessment Guidance)
i)	Embodied Carbon assessment

The Development Zone or Phase shall not be implemented otherwise than in accordance with its respective approved Sustainability and Energy Strategy unless subsequent alternative details are submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority pursuant to this condition.

The details approved on the 20th December 2012 (ref: 2012/4586), the 8th May 2013 (ref: 2013/1193) and the 28th November 2016 (ref. 2016/4804), have partially satisfied the foregoing requirements in relation to Phase 1. 

B) Within 3 months of the commencement of any particular applicable category of use of any Development Zone or Phase, a timetable for the commencement of such use within the relevant Development Zone or the Power Station Building shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 

The details app
Condition : 36 - 36. A) A Sustainable Waste Strategy shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority for each Phase of the development. No Phase of development shall commence until details of the methods and designated areas and locations for storage and separation of general and recyclable waste and the means of its disposal have been submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing, in association with the details required under Condition 03. The submission shall include a Circular Economy Statement in line with the GLA's Circular Economy Statement Guidance for each Phase of the development. Community Infrastructure Levy (CIL):  From the information available, it appears that the development permitted is subject to a Community Infrastructure Levy charge in accordance with the Community Infrastructure Levy Regulations 2010 (as amended). You or the relevant interested parties are required to provide the Council with the information set out in the Regulations. The process for the collection of CIL includes:
- the requirement to complete an "Assumption of Liability" form as soon as possible;
- to claim charitable exemption, social housing relief, self-build exemption or residential annex/extension exemption you or the relevant interested party must complete the correct claim form 
The Council will issue a Liability Notice(s) which details the charges due. As soon as the developer, landowner of other interested party(ies) is aware of the date when development is going to start they must also submit a "Commencement Notice". Failure to comply with the Regulations, including failure to complete the forms when required or providing inaccurate information can lead to surcharges, invalidate claims for relief or exemption from the charge, or other penalties as set out in the Regulations. General information on the Community Infrastructure Levy, including the forms mentioned above can be found on the Planning Portal (www.planningportal.gov.uk). Details of the Mayoral CIL can be found on the GLA and TfL websites (www.london.gov.uk and www.tfl.gov.uk). The Assumption of Liability Form, Claiming of Exemption or Relief Forms and Commencement Notice must be sent to:

Community Infrastructure Levy
Environment and Community Services
Wandsworth Council
Town Hall
London
SW18 2PU
cil@wandsworth.gov.uk
Fax: 020 8871 6003 (marked FAO CIL)

Condition : 95 - INFORMATIVE: 6.	Any works in or over the channel of the River Thames, or within 16 metres landward of the associated Thames Tidal defence would require a Flood Risk Activity Permit under the Environmental Permitted Regulations. Due to the nature of the proposed works and the proximity of the works to the river wall, which forms part of the Thames Tidal Defences, a bespoke permit is necessary.

The application for a Flood Risk Activity Permit would need to be accompanied by full details of the proposed works; this would include all relevant plan and section drawings, details method statement for all aspects of the works and supporting calculations to ensure that the works will not have a negative impact on the integrity of the river wall. The supporting details should cover all details of any temporary works associated with the proposal. It is essential that the crest height of the river wall is maintained throughout the duration of any work and once the works are completed, demonstration should be given in any supporting documentation that this will be the case.

There are larger water mains adjacent to the proposed development. Thames Water will not allow any building within 5m of them and will require 24-hour access for maintenance purposes. You are advised to contact Thames Water's Developer Services regarding the above issues on Tel: 0845 850 2777 to discuss the options available at this site. 
Condition : 97 - INFORMATIVE: 8.	With regard to surface water drainage it is the responsibility of a developer to make proper provision for drainage to ground, water courses or a suitable sewer. In respect of surface water it is recommended that the applicant should ensure that storm flows are attenuated or regulated into the receiving public network through on or off site storage. When it is proposed to connect to a combined public sewer, the site drainage should be separate and combined at the final manhole nearest the boundary. Connections are not permitted for the removal of groundwater. Where the developer proposes to discharge to a public sewer, prior approval from Thames Water Developer Services will be required. They can be contacted on 0845 850 2777. 
Condition : 98 - INFORMATIVE: 9.	Where a developer proposes to discharge groundwater into a public sewer, a groundwater discharge permit will be required. Groundwater discharges typically result from construction site dewatering, deep excavations, basement infiltration, borehole installation, testing and site remediation. Groundwater permit enquiries should be directed to Thames Waters Risk Management Team by telephoning 020 8507 4890 or by e-mailing wwqriskmanagement@thameswater.co.uk Application forms should be completed on line via www.thameswater.co.uk/wastewaterquality. Any discharge made without a permit is deemed illegal and may result in prosecution under the provisions of the Water Industry Act 1991.
